annotations: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D), NIMH
9.  I thought my life had been a failure.
Below is a list of the ways you might have felt or behaved. Please tell me how often you have felt this way during the past week.

1.  I was bothered by things that usually don’t bother me. 2.  I did not feel like eating; my appetite was poor. 3.  I felt that I could not shake off the blues even with help from my family or friends. 4.  I felt I was just as good as other people. 5.  I had trouble keeping my mind on what I was doing. 6.  I felt depressed.
7.  I felt that everything I did was an effort. 8.  I felt hopeful about the future.
19.  I felt that people dislike me.
